name: fluorescence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
light produced by a substance that has absorbed light or other radiation, which has a longer wavelength than the light that has been absorbed: The compound emits blue fluorescence.
the quality of absorbing light of a short wavelength and producing light of a longer wavelength: The mechanisms of fluorescence have applications in television, fluorescent lighting, and radiography.
More examplesFewer examplesThey check the samples under a microscope for bright-green fluorescence. The sky glared with the blanched fluorescence of a shaving light. This phenomenon, known as daylight fluorescence, is common to fluorite from many Weardale locations.UV radiation is often used in visible spectrophotometry to determine the existence of fluorescence in a given sample.When submitted to UV light, the image seems to dim the natural fluorescence of the cloth.
